author: cnbc.com
title: Synaptics reports 2Q loss
text:
SAN JOSE, Calif. (AP) _ Synaptics Inc. (SYNA) on Wednesday reported a fiscal second-quarter loss of $82.4 million, after reporting a profit in the same period a year earlier.
The San Jose, California-based company said it had a loss of $2.42 per share. Earnings, adjusted for pretax expenses and costs related to mergers and acquisitions, came to $1.11 per share.
The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of eight analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.09 per share.
The maker of touch-screen technology posted revenue of $430.4 million in the period, missing Street forecasts. Six analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $432.6 million.
Synaptics shares have risen nearly 3 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $41, a fall of 28 percent in the last 12 months.
